sub_title: Head of ESA Business Incubation and ΦLabNet at the European Space Agency
summary:
Cornelis Eldering (Niels) is Head of Office within the Commercialisation Department at the European Space Agency. Together with his team, from 2003 until today, he built the largest space entrepreneurial network in the world, i.e. ESA's Business Incubation Centres (ESA BICs) Network. Today, he leads the office responsible for the ESA BIC network, the ESA ΦLab Network, and ESA's Partnership Initiative for Commercialisation (EPIC).

ESA currently has 25 Business Incubation Centers (ESA BICs) and 8 Technology Brokers across its member states. The primary aim of the ESA BICs is to provide support to entrepreneurs who wish to exploit space-based solutions. Similarly, ESA 's Technology Brokers support established industrial players in both space and non-space markets. The approach has been adopted for similar technology transfer and incubation activities by e.g. STFC, CERN, Fraunhofer, Czech Invest. New to the office's activities is the ΦLabNet, a network of deep tech research centres aiming to use space as a vector for disruptive innovations that lead the way for Europe's endeavour in New Space commercialisation. 

Niels holds a MSc(BA) from the Rotterdam School of Management (RSM), where he in 2003 completed his research on setting up a strategy for the first ESA Business Incubation Centre. Since then, he was instrumental in evolving and expanding the ESA BICs and Broker network to its current size. Up until his appointment as section head, Niels has chaired over 200 evaluation boards for ESA BIC start-up company selection and evaluated over 3.000 business cases. Passionately, he provides keynote presentations on conferences as well as guest lectures such as to the CEMS Master in International Management. 

In 2015 he received the RSM Distinguished Alumni Award for Senior Leader due to his efforts in creating benefits for society by engaging business and education with space technology. Besides his career at ESA, Niels is currently a PhD candidate (part-time) at the RSM department for Technology and Operations Management and recently published a chapter in an international handbook of research on Business and Technology Incubation and Acceleration. Moreover, together with RSM, the University of St. Gallen and the NOVA Business School, he initiated the Space for Business Executive Education course which brings together business professionals, policymakers, entrepreneurs and investors to learn about new business models and best practices for for the New Space economy.

profile_positions.description: Head of Office within the Commercialisation Department of the Directorate of Commercialisation, Industrial Policy and Competitiveness (D/CIC)  at the European Space Agency and responsible for ESA's Business Incubation Centres (ESA BICs), the ESA ΦLab network, the ESA Technology Transfer Brokers network and ESA's Partnership Initiative for Commercialisation (EPIC).
profile_positions.title: Head of the ESA Business Incubation Centres and ΦLabNet Office

profile_positions.description: Head of Space Solutions, i.e. the section within the Downstream Business Applications Department of the Directorate of Telecommunications and Integrated Applications (TIA) at the European Space Agency responsible for ESA’s Business Incubation Centres (ESA BICs), the ESA Technology Transfer Broker network and the Business Applications Ambassador network. Duties included developing a new section approach and its team, merging the Broker activities with the Ambassador activities (TE+AM), as well as improving the ESA Technology Broker Network by setting up the SPARK funding call and the further expansion of the Broker Network.
profile_positions.title: Head of the ESA Space Solutions Section: ESA BICs, Technology Brokers & Ambassadors

profile_positions.description: Technology Transfer Officer and deputy head of office within the Directorate of Technology Engineering and Quality (TEC), responsible for ESA Business Incubation and defining the overall approach and strategy for technology transfer between space and non-space industry, including the incubation of start-up companies and their funding. Duties included representing ESTEC and D/TEC in the negotiation with the Dutch Government for financing and developing  a new ESA BIC facility next to ESTEC at the NL Space Campus, as well as the further expansion of the ESA BIC Network.
profile_positions.title: Technology Transfer Officer
